greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that number of parts is equal to the sum of parts counted without multiplicities.
comment: The Heinz numbers of these integer partitions are given by A324570. - _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 09 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(12) = 5 integer partitions (empty columns not shown):
maple: a:=proc(n) local P,c,j,S: with(combinat): P:=partition(n): c:=0: for j from 1 to nops(P) do S:=convert(P[j],set): if nops(P[j])=sum(S[i],i=1..nops(S)) then c:=c+1 else c:=c fi: c: od: end: seq(a(n), n=0..35); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 01 2006
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{P, c, j, S}, P = IntegerPartitions[n]; c = 0; For[j = 1, j <= Length[P], j++, S = Union[P[[j]]]; If[Length[P[[j]]] == Total[S],  c++] ]; c];
xref: Cf. A116861 (number of partitions of n having a given sum of distinct parts).
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 18 2006
